preqs: ACF5100 or AFF5100 and ACF5120 or AFF5120 and ACF5130 or AFF5130 and ACF5150 or AFF5150

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACF5100, ACF5130, AFF5100, AFF5130} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5100, AFF5100} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5120, AFF5120} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5130, AFF5130} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5150, AFF5150} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
(Must be enrolled in course version {0503, 3850, 4401, B6002} and Must be enrolled in course type {03, 04, 05, 06, 07, 11, 42, 50PG})

description: This capstone unit requires students to synthesize, analyse, evaluate and apply prior knowledge and skills gained throughout the Master of Accounting in a manner that is designed to enhance their ability to transition to a chosen career path. The unit adopts a thematic approach that examines how external and regulatory factors, decision making processes, and stakeholder expectations interact to drive contemporary organisational success. Collectively, these three interrelated pillars of knowledge provide a comprehensive framework for those aspiring for challenging accounting and finance positions. Content is delivered in a weekly seminar format and draws upon selected case studies that cover topics including strategy, corporate governance, financial reporting and performance management. Given the integrative nature of the unit, assessment is primarily based on a combination of individual and group case study analysis.
